pageContext.claim: “I hate the children being taken away. The Democrats have to change their law. That's their law. ... You can't do it through an executive order.”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, families are being separated because of a "zero tolerance" policy from the Trump administration dating to April 2018. No law, whether passed by Democrats or otherwise, requires these separations. Trump signed an executive order to end family separations shortly after saying it couldn't be done through an executive order.
